result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony John Hessling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall participate in an AODA assessment and all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or school or a combination thereof.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony John Hessling

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony John Hessling in court. Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court for Anthony John Hessling. Prosecuting attorney Daniel j Gabler Mr. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached. Def pleads guilty; is convicted. Statements by counsel and defendant. Defendant sentenced.
Sent certified copy of Bail/Bond and court record with invoice to Fond du Lac Co DA per request rec'd 10-13-22

Defendant Anthony John Hessling in court. Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court for Anthony John Hessling. Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for State of Wisconsin. Witnesses: Officer Nicholas Pradarelli (SPD); Officer Justin Pesch (GPD). State rests. Witness: Anthony H. Defense rests. Argument by counsel. Court places findings on the record. Court finds that defendant was not prohibited from leaving the scene of the stop and the canine sniff was permissible. Therefore, the defense motion is denied. Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony John Hessling in court. Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court for Anthony John Hessling. Information on file; reading waived. NG PLEAS entered. Motion hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Notice of Motion for Suppression of Fruits of Vehicle Search

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony John Hessling in court. Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court for Anthony John Hessling. Preliminary hearing waived. Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information. Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anthony John Hessling in court. Attorney Theodore R Rolfs in court for Anthony John Hessling. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
